intro: Ternstroemia brasiliensis, commonly known as Brazilian holly, is a member of the Theaceae family. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. The plant has simple, opposite, and usually elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy berries. The botanical features of Ternstroemia brasiliensis make it an important species in tropical ecosystems.
